ad vīllam

Chapter 2

ager
agrī m.
field
derivative: agriculture, agrarian
ambulō
ambulāre
to walk
derivative: amble, ambulatory
amīca
amīcae f.
friend
derivative: amicable
currō
currere
to run
derivative: occur, current, course
dēfessus
dēfessa, dēfessum
tired
etiam
also
ex
(takes ablative)
out of, away from
faciō
facere
to make, do
derivative: manufacture, effect, confection
hodiē
today
iam
now
lentē
slowly
nōn
not
nōn iam
no longer
quod
because
quoque
also
saepe
often
strēnuus
strēnua, strēnuum

sum
esse
to be
tandem

ubi
where

Prepositional Phrases

ex agrīs
(ablative plural)
out of the fields
ex agro
(ablative singular)
out of the field

Other Phrases

brevi tempore
in short time

Infinitive Conjugations

1st Conjugation
to walk
currere
3rd Conjugation
to run

irregular
to be
facere
3rd Conjugation
to make, to do
